doc: ['The city and the car .', 'The social science have generally ignored the motor car and its awesome consequence for social life , especially in their analysis of the urban .', "Urban study in particular has failed to consider the overwhelming impact of the automobile in transforming the time-space 'scapes ' of the modern urban/suburban dweller .", 'Focusing on form of mobility into , across and through the city , we consider how the car reconfigures urban life , involving distinct way of dwelling , travelling and socializing in , and through , an automobilized time-space .', "We trace urban sociology 's paradoxical resistance to culture of mobility , and argue that civil society should be reconceptualized as a 'civil society of automobility ' .", 'We then explore how automobility makes instantaneous time and the negotiation of extensive space central to how social life is configured .', 'As people dwell in and socially interact through their car , they become hyphenated car-drivers : at home in movement , transcending distance to complete a series of activity within fragmented moment of time .', 'Urban social life has always entailed various mobility but the car transforms these in a distinct combination of flexibility and coercion .', 'Automobility is a complex amalgam of interlocking machine , social practice and way of dwelling which have reshaped citizenship and the public sphere via the mobilization of modern civil society .', "In the conclusion we trace a vision of an evolved automobility for the city of tomorrow in which public space might again be made 'public ' .", 'The relation between perceived sensory dimension of urban green space and stress restoration .', 'Research indicates a relationship between sensory perception of natural environment and human health .', 'Our hypothesis is that people perceive green space in term of certain dimension , where some dimension are more important and preferred than others with respect to restoring people from stress .', 'The aim are to : identify and describe the perceived dimension in nature ; identify which dimension people in general prefer ; identify the dimension people reporting stress prefer ; and identify a combination of the dimension people reporting stress prefer .', 'A total of 953 randomly selected informant from nine Swedish city ( representative of the Swedish population ) answered a postal questionnaire with pre-coded question .', 'The questionnaire consisted of three part : personal data , preference for natural quality and self-estimations of health status .', 'The data were analyzed using factor analysis and regression analysis .', 'The result identify and describe eight perceived sensory dimension .', 'People in general prefer the dimension Serene , followed by Space , Nature , Rich in Species , Refuge , Culture , Prospect and Social .', 'The dimension Refuge and Nature are most strongly correlated with stress , indicating a need to find the most restorative environment .', 'A combination of Refuge , Nature and Rich in Species , and a low or no presence of Social , could be interpreted as the most restorative environment for stressed individual .', 'From a city planning perspective , the result indicate how urban green space can be viewed as element of importance to public mental health .', 'However , before the dimension can be used by practitioner as tool to promote health through city planning , more research is needed .', 'Typhoid fever in child aged less than 5 year .', 'Background .', 'Calculation of the incidence of typhoid fever during preschool year is important to define the optimum age of immunisation and the choice of vaccine for public-health programme in developing country .', 'Hospital-based study have suggested that child younger than 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever , but this view needs to be re-examined in community-based longitudinal study .', 'We undertook a prospective follow-up study of resident of a low-income urban area of Delhi , India , with active surveillance for case detection .', 'Method .', 'A baseline census was undertaken in 1995 .', 'Between Nov 1 , 1995 , and Oct 31 , 1996 , we visited 8172 resident of 1820 household in Kalkaji , Delhi , twice weekly to detect febrile case .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding .', '63 culture-positive typhoid fever case were detected .', 'Of these , 28 ( 44 % ) were in child aged under 5 year .', 'The incidence rate of typhoid per 1000 person-years was 27.3 at age under 5 year , 11.7 at 5-19 year , and 1.1 between 19 and 40 year .', 'The difference in the incidence of typhoid fever between those under 5 year and those aged 5-19 year ( 15.6 per 1000 person-years [ 95 % CI 4.7-26.5 ] ) , and those aged 19-40 year ( 26.2 [ 16.0-36.3 ] ) was significant ( p < 0.001 far both ) .', 'The difference between the incidence of typhoid at 5-19 year and the incidence at 19-40 year was also significant ( 10.6 [ 6.3-14.8 ] , p < 0 001 ) .', 'Morbidity in those under 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and need for hospital admission .', 'Interpretation .', 'Our finding challenge the common view that typhoid fever is a disorder of school-age child and of adult .', 'Typhoid is a common and significant cause of morbidity between 1 and 5 year of age .', 'The optimum age of typhoid immunisation and the choice of vaccine need to be reassessed.This study was conducted to measure the incidence of typhoid fever among preschooler .', 'It was suggested that child aged 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever .', 'However or in other developing country .', 'A reevaluation of the optimum age and vaccine of choice is needed .', 'Ten question on the soundscapes of the built environment .', "Soundscape research represents a paradigm shift from noise control policy towards a new multidisciplinary approach as it involves not only physical measurement but also the cooperation of humanity and social science to account for the diversity of soundscapes across country and culture , with more focus on how people actually experience the acoustic environment ; and it considers environmental sound as a 'resource ' rather than a 'waste ' .", 'The ten question presented in this paper range from the very basic definition underlying the emerging soundscape science , to more applied topic about how to use soundscape as a design approach for the planning and management of the built environment .', 'Although significant research activity has been conducted so far , there is still a need to systematically provide the underpinning science and practical guidance in soundscaping .', 'Thus , the last question aim to identify the most crucial gap in soundscape research and set the agenda for future advancement in the field .', 'Beyond binary choice : Integrating individual and social creativity .', 'The power of the unaided individual mind is highly overrated .', 'Although society often thinks of creative individual as working in isolation , intelligence and creativity result in large part from interaction and collaboration with other individual .', 'Much human creativity is social , arising from activity that take place in a context in which interaction with other people and the artifact that embody collective knowledge are essential contributor .', "This paper examines : ( 1 ) how individual and social creativity can be integrated by mean of proper collaboration model and tool supporting distributed cognition ; ( 2 ) how the creation of shareable externalization ( `` boundary object '' ) and the adoption of evolutionary process model in the construction of meta-design environment can enhance creativity and support spontaneous design activity ( `` unselfconscious culture of design '' ) ; and ( 3 ) how a new design competence is emerging - one that requires passage from individual creative action to synergetic activity , from the reflective practitioner to reflective community and from given task to personally meaningful activity .", 'The paper offers example in the context of collaborative design and art practice , including urban planning , interactive art and open source .', "In the effort to draw a viable path `` beyond binary choice '' , the paper points out some major challenge for the next generation of socio-technical environment to further increase the integration of individual and social creativity .", 'Capitalising on multiplicity : A transdisciplinary system approach to landscape research .', 'Different discipline have landscape as the focal point of their research .', 'They are successful in presenting new finding about landscape within their specialisation , but collaboration - and thus , transfer of knowledge across disciplinary boundary - is seldom realised because a common approach that bridges the gap between discipline is missing .', 'Instead , different landscape concept exist side by side .', 'Yet , cooperation is required to tackle the various environmental and social problem related to landscape .', 'This paper provides an overview of the historical development of landscape concept originating from different cultural and scientific trend , and presents a new complex concept of landscape , which is designed to enable transdisciplinary landscape research .', 'The transdisciplinary landscape concept is based on five dimension of landscape : the spatial entity , the mental entity , the temporal dimension , the nexus of nature and culture , and the systemic property of landscape .', 'In contrast to other approach , it unites dimension that are usually the domain of individual discipline and makes it , thus , possible to capitalise on plurality in landscape research .', 'The concept promotes landscape as the combination of the subsystem known as the geo- , bio- and noo-sphere , and is illustrated by the people-landscape interaction model .', 'The concept can be applied to all human-landscape-related research , but is exemplified by two study that have investigated the relationship between landscape and second-home tourism , and landscape and farming , respectively .', 'Good looking : In defense of scenic landscape aesthetic .', "Among US writer on environmental aesthetic , it has become de rigueur to leverage Aldo Leopold 's legacy against the proliferation of `` popular '' landscape taste , which are typically seen to have their origin in 17th-19th century European tradition of landscape painting and aesthetic .", "These writer regard victim of popular or `` scenic '' landscape taste ( exemplified by Olmsted 's Central Park ) as intellectually shallow , motivated by momentary `` sensory pleasure '' , and passively and anthropocentrically drawn to `` naturalistic '' environment rather than actively and biocentrically engaged with natural environment .", 'This implicit refusal to grant sensory information and affective processing the power to catalyze and inform serious reflection is not new ; neither is the attribution of popular landscape aesthetic to the elite society of a limited culture and historical period surprising , given the current preponderance of post-modernist sensibility .', 'However , in the often highly-charged atmosphere of local environmental planning and management arenas , both position are needlessly polemical .', 'More importantly , there is good evidence to suggest that both position are founded on misconception about how the human mind work .', 'In this paper , we will review work that establishes the intellectual bona fides of visual imagery , the important contribution that emotion make to cognition , and the likelihood that explanation of environmental aesthetic rooted in European enlightenment-era landscape painting are inadequate .', 'This review suggests that frequent call for new normative environmental aesthetic based on a cognitive understanding of ecological sustainability are likely premature .', 'As social scientist , we suggest that attempt to impose prescribed environmental aesthetic ( albeit ecologically pure environmental aesthetic ) are inappropriate and may well be self-defeating .', 'Instead , we suggest that a thorough understanding of visual and non-visual environmental aesthetic is needed , including examination of the possibility that affect elicited by scenic encounter with preferred landscape can lead people to form emotional attachment to the land and thereby develop a greater appreciation for sustainability goal .', 'Place , culture , and the social amplification of risk .', 'This article investigates the role of culture in the social production of risk and risk communication surrounding industrial development in a region located at a rural-urban interface .', 'A case study examined a public consultation that was undertaken to inform local resident about an eco-industrial development proposal being planned near Edmonton , Alberta , Canada .', 'The research employed the social amplification of risk framework ( SARF ) to examine the relationship among culture , place , and socially constructed risk .', 'A total of 44 in-depth , semi-structured interview were carried out with 33 landowner ( farmer , acreage owner ) , public official ( municipal politician , administrator ) , journalist , and industry representative .', 'Analysis revealed that risk communication occurred in relation to situated experience of place that were based on conflicting cultural worldviews .', 'The research shows that place is a useful component of the SARF , providing a spatial explanation for why some people amplify , and others attenuate , risk in locally contentious environmental debate .', 'Vision of nature and landscape type preference : An exploration in The Netherlands .', "A survey was carried out among inhabitant of Gennep , a small-town municipality in the east of The Netherlands , questioning about ( 1 ) the type of nature that people distinguish and the level of naturalness ascribed to these type of nature ; ( 2 ) the image that people hold of the appropriate relationship between people and nature and the level of adherence to these image , and ( 3 ) people 's preference of broadly defined landscape type .", 'Type of nature inferred by mean of factor analysis were labeled arcadian , wild and penetrative nature , the last category comprising element such as mosquito and rat in the barn .', 'Factor analysis was used as well to infer image of appropriate relationship , which appeared to hinge around the concept of mastery over nature , responsibility for nature and participation in nature , respectively .', "Level of adherence to the responsibility and participation image were very high , indicative of a 'new biophilia ' mainstream in Dutch culture .", "Landscape type were defined , roughly , as ( 1 ) landscape made by and for people ; ( 2 ) park-like , arcadian landscape ; ( 3 ) wild , interactive landscape and ( 4 ) landscape `` in which one may experience the greatness and force of nature '' .", "Strikingly , more than half of the respondent expressed preference for this last ( 'deep ecology ' ) landscape type , with another third preferring the wild , interactive landscape .", "The highest preference of the 'greatness and force ' landscape was found among the respondent with high ascription of naturalness to the penetrative type of nature and respondent adhering to the participation-in-nature image of relationship .", 'Preference for landscape type as defined here should be distinguished from visual or behavioral landscape preference .', "Even if people may not select landscape of the 'greatness and force of nature ' in daily behavior , these landscape of wilderness and greatness do connect with human vision and desire .", 'Social impact assessment and public participation in China : A case study of land requisition in Guangzhou .', "This study examines the current prospect for and obstacle facing the implementation of social impact assessment ( SIA ) and participatory planning in the People 's Republic of China .", 'During the past two decade , rapid urbanisation and the conversion of rural land for urban development have led to numerous social conflict and tension between the Chinese government and its people .', 'SIA and public participation in development decision have received increasing attention from the Chinese authority as possible way to tackle the problem .', 'Based on a Guangzhou case study , this paper argues that the assessment and mitigation of adverse impact on the community from urban development have been carried out with different objective , core value and principle when compared with those in Western society .', 'It concludes that the poor prospect of SIA and collaborative planning in China lie not only in the weak framework for environmental legislation , but also in all institution concerning state-society relation , the socialist governing ideology and traditional Chinese culture .', 'Revanchist sanitisation or coercive care ?', 'The use of enforcement to combat begging , street drinking and rough sleeping in England .', "This paper examines recent response to 'problematic street culture ' in England , where increasing pressure has been exerted to prevent people from begging and street drinking in public space , with rough sleeping also targeted in some area .", "Drawing upon in-depth interview with enforcement agent , support provider and targeted individual , it assesses the extent to which the strategy employed are indicative of a 'revanchist expulsion ' of the deviant Other and/or an expression of 'coercive care ' for the vulnerable Other .", 'It concludes that , whilst the recent development appear , at first glance , to be symptomatic of revanchist sanitisation of public space , closer examination reveals that the situation is actually much more complex than a revanchist reading of the situation might suggest , and perhaps not as devoid of compassion .', 'Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', 'Historical and contemporary cultural ecosystem service value in the rapidly urbanizing city state of Singapore .', 'Cultural ecosystem service are a function of people and place , so may change as a location transition from rural to urban .', 'Singapore has undergone rapid urbanization after its independence in 1965 , with a concomitant decline in natural habitat extent and accessibility .', 'Using coastal mangrove forest as a case study habitat , changing cultural value were explored with a novel array of technique , including qualitative archival analysis ( photographs , oral history ) , current source ( publically uploaded social medium photographs ) , and survey of ( a ) the general public and ( b ) visitor to publically accessible mangrove .', 'Cultural value changed through time , with a significant transition from intrinsic , intrapersonal value ( spiritual , cultural heritage ) to instrumental , interpersonal value ( recreation , education ) .', 'Additionally , cultural value varied between different mangrove depending on their public accessibility , and the evolving degree of human interaction with the ecosystem as urban development occured .', 'Cultural value change as development transition , though mangrove still play an important cultural role in a heavily urbanized environment .', "Reading landscape meaning : State construction and lived experience in Singapore 's Chinatown .", "The term 'landscape '' embodies multiple level of meaning : it articulates the ideological intent of the powerful who plan or shape the landscape in particular way and at the same time reflects the everyday meaning implicit in the daily routine of ordinary people associated with the landscape .", "Through an analysis of four theme constituting the landscape of Singapore 's Chinatown , we unpack two different but interdependent version of landscape reality : the construction of social meaning from the state 's perspective and those derived from the lived experience of Chinatown 's inhabitant .", "In our first theme , we explore the multiplicity of meaning invested in Chinatown 's housing landscape .", 'For the state , urban renewal and public housing scheme in Chinatown represent the redrawing of landscape along modernist line informed by efficiency and rationality of land use , in tandem with the larger goal of nation-building .', 'Among resident , however , the vision of modern living in everyday life was only a reality for a few ; others experience the landscape in more contradictory way .', 'Second , in the landscape of community building , we show that state-initiated effort at inculcating a sense of community have replaced the old spontaneous , interpersonal tie and the strength of organised vernacular association .', 'Inadvertently , these state strategy have in some way actually been damaging and deleterious to community tie .', 'In our third theme , we show how the state has , to a large extent , successfully rewritten the socially and physically polluted landscape of Chinatown .', "Yet , there are example of resistance where the state 's vision of an unpolluted landscape has been punctured .", "Since the mid-1980s , a fourth imperative has emerged in the state 's management of the Chinatown landscape in the form of attempt to conserve the landscape as a `` historic district '' , a repository of the nation 's tradition , history and culture .", "We show that there are different interpretation of the state 's effort to revitalise Chinese culture in the conserved landscape and its attempt to cast Chinatown in the role of a `` common bond place '' for all Singaporeans .", "Singapore 's Chinatown is thus a multicoded landscape inscribed with a multiplicity of meaning .", 'It is neither used entirely as an ideological tool for manipulative end nor does it fully embody the authenticity of daily experience .', 'Moving young life : Mobility , immobility and inter-generational tension in urban Africa .', "This paper explores young people 's experience and perception of mobility and mobility constraint in poorer urban area of Ghana , Malawi and South Africa within the specific context of inter-generational relation .", "Drawing principally on qualitative research finding from a study involving both adult and child researcher , our aim is to chart the diversity and commonality of urban young people 's mobility experience in the everyday - how they use and experience the city - developing a comparative perspective across three urban study site which links young people 's mobility with the power relation that operate to shape their movement in individual location .", "In particular , we consider how positive and negative image of young people 's mobility play out in term of the inter-generational friction and negotiation generated by their mobility performance .", "We also reflect on the developmental implication , in term of young people 's access to service and income and their participation in the social network and peer culture which may shape their life trajectory .", 'Three theme are explored in detail : mobility as challenge , mobility as temptation and mobility control .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'Greater Portland : Urban life and landscape in the Pacific Northwest .', 'It has been called one of the nation ’ s most livable region , ranked among the best managed city in America , hailed as a top spot to work , and favored as a great place to do business , enjoy the art , pursue outdoor recreation , and make one ’ s home .', 'Indeed , year of cooperative urban planning between developer and those interested in ecology and habitability have transformed Portland from a provincial western city into an exemplary American metropolis .', 'Its thriving downtown , its strong neighborhood , and its pioneering effort at local management have brought a steady procession of journalist , scholar , and civic leader to investigate the “ Portland style ” that values dialogue and consensus , treats politics as a civic duty , and assumes that it is possible to work toward public good .', 'Probing behind the press clipping , acclaimed urban historian Carl Abbott examines the character of contemporary Portland-its people , politics , and public life-and the region ’ s history and geography in order to discover how Portland has achieved its reputation as one of the most progressive and livable city in the United States and to determine whether typical pressure of urban growth are pushing Portland back toward the national norm .', 'In Greater Portland , Abbott argues that the city can not be understood without reference to its place .', 'Its river , hill , and broader regional setting have shaped the economy and the cityscape .', 'Portlanders are Oregonians , Northwesteners , Cascadians ; they value their city as much for where it is as for what it is , and this powerful sense of place nurtures a distinctive civic culture .', 'Tracing the way in which Portlanders have talked and thought about their city , Abbott reveals the tension between their diverse vision of the future and plan for development .', 'Most citizen of Portland desire a balance between continuity and change , one that supports urban progress but actively monitors its effect on the region ’ s expansive green space and on the community ’ s culture .', 'This strong civic participation in city planning and politics is what gives greater Portland its unique character , a positive setting for class integration , neighborhood revitalization , and civic value .', 'The result , Abbott confirms , is a region whose unique initiative remain a model of American urban planning .', 'Reclaiming the city : Waterfront development in Singapore .', "In its quest to be a world city , many of Singapore 's urban space have been subjected to constant redevelopment .", 'Derelict waterfront and ageing neighbourhood have been given new life , enjoying their reincarnation as landscape of economy and leisure .', "A prevalent theme in Singapore 's transformation has been the reclamation of landscape to cater to new user , activity and agenda .", 'Adopting a case study of the Singapore River waterfront , this paper analyses three form of urban reclamation .', 'They include reclaiming functionality , aimed at infusing the waterfront with new land uses ; reclaiming access , as a way of opening up the landscape to more people ; and reclaiming the local , as a way to commemorate local culture and history .', 'While government planner and private enterprise are intent on developing a world-class environment , Singaporeans and visitor respond to this urban vision in different way with some praising the dynamism of worldly transformation and others criticising them as a prelude to a soulless city .', 'While some degree of worldliness is essential in any redevelopment , a fine balance has to be sought between the excess of global urbanism and the parochialism of vernacular concern .', 'Natural disaster and nuclear crisis in Japan : Response and recovery after Japan ’ s 3/11 .', 'The March 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan plunged the country into a state of crisis .', 'As the nation struggled to recover from a record breaking magnitude 9 earthquake and a tsunami that was as high as thirty-eight meter in some place , news trickled out that Fukushima had experienced meltdown in three reactor .', 'These tragic catastrophe claimed some 20,000 life , initially displacing some 500,000 people and overwhelming Japan ’ s formidable disaster preparedness.This book brings together the analysis and insight of a group of distinguished expert on Japan to examine what happened , how various institution and actor responded and what lesson can be drawn from Japan ’ s disaster .', 'The contributor , many of whom experienced the disaster first hand , assess the wide–ranging repercussion of this catastrophe and how it is already reshaping Japanese culture , politics , energy policy , and urban planning .', 'Knowledge-Based Regional Economic Development : A Synthetic Review of Knowledge Spillovers , Entrepreneurship , and Entrepreneurial Ecosystems .', 'The geographical nature of knowledge spillover and entrepreneurship has been well documented in the literature .', 'In most regional or urban study , these two topic are separately discussed .', 'This research reviews literature at the intersection of knowledge spillover , entrepreneurship , and regional economic development .', 'The key argument is that entrepreneurship can serve as a mechanism for transmitting knowledge spillover and accordingly contribute to regional innovation , cluster formation , and economic development .', 'However , the effectiveness of this mechanism depends on various factor in the regional entrepreneurial ecosystem , notably including knowledge base , absorptive capacity , competition , network of people , diversity , and culture .', 'Assessing the sustainability of Spanish city considering environmental and socio-economic indicator .', 'The conception of urban metabolism has considered the perspective of environmental sustainability in the framework of city .', 'In this context , city can be regarded complex entity driven by material and energy flow that entail consumption of resource and production of waste material in the pursuit of economic welfare and social progress .', 'According to a sustainability perspective , environmental , social and economic indicator must also be integrated into urban planning process .', 'However , methodological advance regarding the definition and development of sustainable city are required since a consensus of indicator , weighting and data management is still lacking .', 'In this paper , a multi-criteria approach that combine three methodology : Material Flow Analysis ( MFA ) , Life Cycle Assessment ( LCA ) and Data Envelopment Analysis ( DEA ) has been developed and applied to a sample of 26 representative Spanish city with different characteristic ( i.e.', ', population , location , demands , economy , topography and culture ) .', 'The combined approach allows identifying the non-sustainable city considering an offset of indicator from the three pillar of sustainability .', 'With this purpose , the mentioned item are implemented in a DEA model of efficiency , being the inefficient city with an efficiency score lower than 100 % defined as non-sustainable one .', 'Finally , this multi-criteria method allows setting the target value for the assessed indicator ( benchmarked value ) , which become objective for the non-sustainable city to evolve toward a more sustainable performance .', 'The outcome from the analysis have identified six city that ranked worse , with efficiency score ranging from 57.9 % to 85.8 % .', 'According to the target of socio-economic indicator , attention should be paid to AROPE rate ( people at risk of poverty and social exclusion ) , unemployment rate and number of crime , meanwhile lower level of electricity consumption , municipal solid waste and on-site greenhouse gas emission are desirable from an environmental perspective .', 'These outcome are of potential interest for politician , government and inhabitant to aid in the identification of the metabolic flow and social/economic indicator to be optimized in search of sustainability .', 'Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'On the waterfront : Globalization and urbanization in singapore .', "Although many city aspire to `` global-city status , '' few have been as explicit as Singapore in its quest to create urban landscape to project its global aspiration .", "This paper presents the case of the Singapore River development zone as a `` hyper-symbol '' of Singapore 's global urbanism .", "By creating a world-class riverfront not unlike the acclaimed waterfront of London , Sydney , or San Francisco , Singapore 's urban planner hope to project the city as a venue worthy of world-class tourism and leisure activity , an important node in international circuit of capital , and a vibrant city for both foreign visitor and local resident .", "Our paper , however , also argues that local force and influence play a significant role in the waterfront 's development .", 'The Singapore River landscape is the negotiated outcome of both globalism and localism—a dialectical landscape formed by dominant global influence on the one hand , and emerging local process on the other .', 'Fieldwork comprising a questionnaire survey , in-depth interview , and on-site observation provide evidence of such global-local interaction .', 'The paper contends that the challenge at the river are symptomatic of the broader Singapore experience as the city-state grapple with issue of national identity , local empowerment , and community right in the midst of a global convergence of tourist , capital , people , and culture .', 'The middle class in neoliberal China : Governing risk , life-building , and themed space .', "Since the late 1970s , China 's move towards neoliberalism has made it not only one of the world 's fastest growing economy , but also one of the most polarised state .", 'This economic , social and political transformation has led to the emergence of a new Chinese middle class , and understanding the development and the role of this new social group is crucial to understanding contemporary Chinese society .', 'Investigating the new politics of the middle class in China , this book addresses three major question .', 'First , how does the Chinese state deal with problem of national sovereignty and political representation to create the middle class both as a legitimate category of the people and as an ideal norm of citizenship ?', 'Second , how does the recognition of the middle class norm take place in the practice of everyday life ?', 'Finally , what kind of risk does the politics of the middle class generate not only for middle class subject but also for the disenfranchised ?', 'In answering these question , this book examines a set of practice , body of knowledge , measure , and institution that aim to manage , govern , control , and orient the behaviour , gesture , and thought of Chinese citizen .', 'This investigation contributes not only to the understanding of the Chinese middle class society but also to the scholarly debate over the relationship between governmental apparatus , subjectification , and life-building .', 'Drawing on ethnographic information , historical archive , and the medium , this book will be of great interest to student and scholar working in the field of Chinese study , Chinese politics , ethnic study and urban study , as well as those interested in culture , society , class and welfare .', 'Comparison of community response to road traffic noise in Japan and Sweden - Part I : Outline of survey and dose-response relationship .', 'To investigate cross-cultural difference in the community response to road traffic noise , social survey were conducted in Gothenburg , Sweden , and Kumamoto and Sapporo , Japan , using the same questionnaire and noise measurement method .', 'Typical residential area with detached house and apartment were selected as the target area in each city .', 'The questionnaire comprised 40 question relating to environmental , housing and personal factor .', 'The key question concerned annoyance caused by road traffic noise .', 'The total number of respondent were 1142 in Gothenburg , 837 in Kumamoto and 780 in Sapporo .', 'The response rate were 68.8 , 69.3 and 57.5 % respectively .', 'After the questionnaire were completed , noise measurement were made in each area .', 'Community response were compared on the basis of the dose-response relationship .', 'There were no systematic difference between community response in Sapporo and Kumamoto , which have the same culture .', 'People living in detached house in Gothenburg were more annoyed by the same road traffic noise than the people living in Japanese city .', 'There were no systematic difference among the three city with regard to activity disturbance indoors , but significant disturbance of activity and resting in garden or on balcony was noted in Gothenburg .', 'The
